intro: Erigeron chihuahuanus, commonly known as the Chihuahua fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as hairy leaves and a deep root system to conserve water. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron chihuahuanus is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native range.
